TITLE: Factbox: Brexit and the City of London: what has changed?
DESCRIPTION: Britain and the European Union agreed a new post-Brexit financial services pact on Friday that will allow them to co-operate on regulation but does little to improve the City of London's access to the bloc.

TITLE: Britain and EU strike financial services cooperation pact
DESCRIPTION: Britain and the European Union agreed a new post-Brexit financial services pact on Friday that will allow them to co-operate on regulation but does little to improve the City of London's access to the bloc.

TITLE: Irish court clears Norwegian Air restructuring for take-off
DESCRIPTION: Ireland's High Court cleared the way on Friday for Norwegian Air to raise new capital and emerge from bankruptcy protection in Ireland and Norway in May by approving the airline's restructuring scheme.

TITLE: UK lawmakers accept BoE Bailey's explanations on LCF fund collapse
DESCRIPTION: British lawmakers drew a line on Friday under a spat between Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey and the author of a report that blamed the collapse of an investment company on failures in his supervision.

TITLE: Ditch Libor on time or lose your bonus, Bank of England tells bankers
DESCRIPTION: Bankers in charge of ensuring that the tarnished Libor interest rate benchmark is ditched by an end-December deadline should lose their bonuses if they fail to make progress, the Bank of England said on Friday.

TITLE: U.S. Senate Democrats aim to undo Trump-era shareholder voting rights rule
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Democrats on Friday introduced a resolution to rescind a rule they say curbs shareholder voting rights, their second move aimed at unraveling business regulations introduced by former President Donald Trump's administration.

TITLE: Blockchain forensics startup Chainalysis raises $100 million at $2 billion valuation
DESCRIPTION: New York-based Chainalysis, a startup that allows companies and government agencies to analyse and investigate blockchain transactions, said on Friday it had raised $100 million from investors at a valuation of more than $2 billion.

TITLE: UK fund manager LGIM says it is unlikely to participate in Deliveroo IPO
DESCRIPTION: British money manager Legal & General Investment Management said on Thursday it is unlikely to participate in food delivery firm Deliveroo's upcoming initial public offering (IPO) due to the enhanced voting rights held by founder Will Shu.

TITLE: SPAC trading pops deflate as 'exuberance and greed' depart
DESCRIPTION: Wall Street's appetite for new special purpose acquisition companies (SPACs) shows signs of waning.

TITLE: Yellen now open to U.S. bank dividend payouts, stock buybacks
DESCRIPTION: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Wednesday said U.S. banks look healthy enough to be allowed to pay dividends and repurchase stock, an updated view that reflects top economic officials' growing confidence in the recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: Bitcoin can prosper without becoming a major currency: SkyBridge's Scaramucci
DESCRIPTION: Bitcoin doesn't need to become a widely-used form of payment to succeed and could prosper solely as a store of value, SkyBridge Capital founder Anthony Scaramucci said on Wednesday.

TITLE: UK stands pat on Brexit swaps trading as EU banks hurt
DESCRIPTION: Britain's Financial Conduct Authority said on Wednesday it will not change its open stance on cross-border derivatives trading with the European Union, introduced following Brexit.

TITLE: Chinese regulator punishes Haitong Securities over risk control measures
DESCRIPTION: China's securities regulator said on Wednesday it had suspended Haitong Securities Co Ltd from conducting bond investment advisory work for institutional investors due to what it called lax risk control measures.

TITLE: 'No rush' on City of London access to EU, says EU official
DESCRIPTION: The European Union and Britain expect to agree a cooperation framework for financial services by the end of March, but there will be "no rush" in granting the City of London access to the EU, the bloc's financial services chief said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Customers decide where to clear euro swaps, Deutsche Bank tells EU
DESCRIPTION: Splits in derivatives markets due to Brexit present big operational and revenue challenges for banks in the European Union and it will be customers not policymakers who decide where to clear swaps, a senior Deutsche Bank official said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Exclusive: Business payments firm AvidXchange preps for IPO, eyeing $7 billion valuation - sources
DESCRIPTION: AvidXchange Inc has hired investment banks including Goldman Sachs Group to lead preparations for an initial public offering which may value the business payments processor at more than $7 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. business borrowing for equipment rises 9% in February: ELFA
DESCRIPTION: U.S. companies' borrowings for capital investments rose about 9% in February from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Monday.

TITLE: Slow shift from Libor for U.S. business loans 'concerning': industry group
DESCRIPTION: U.S. banks have been slow to offer non-financial firms alternatives to Libor rates for business loans, leaving many companies unprepared for the upcoming end of the benchmark rate and threatening broader market liquidity, an industry group said on Monday.

TITLE: Mexico's central bank seen maintaining key rate at 4.0%: Reuters poll
DESCRIPTION: The Mexican central bank is seen keeping its benchmark interest rate steady at its next monetary policy meeting on Thursday as inflation ticks up amid the battered economy's recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.

TITLE: Revolut submits draft application for U.S. bank charter
DESCRIPTION: London-based financial technology startup Revolut said on Monday it had completed the first step to apply for a U.S. banking licence, and is launching its services for businesses across 50 states.

TITLE: Explainer: What rising bond yields mean for markets
DESCRIPTION: Yields on U.S. Treasuries have surged to their highest level in more than a year from record lows hit in 2020, as Federal Reserve commitments to hold rates near zero for years to come encouraged investors to bet economic growth and inflation will heat up.

TITLE: White House says working to give relief to student loan borrowers
DESCRIPTION: White House Principal Deputy Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre on Friday said the Biden administration was working to give full relief to student loan borrowers who have been taken advantage of.

TITLE: U.S. Justice Department probing Visa over debit practices
DESCRIPTION: The Justice Department is looking at Visa Inc's debit practices, the company said on Friday, after reports the United States was investigating whether the credit card company uses anticompetitive practices in the debit-card market.

TITLE: Insurer Chubb offers to acquire rival Hartford for $23.24 billion
DESCRIPTION: Property and casualty insurer Chubb Ltd on Thursday offered to acquire smaller rival Hartford Financial Services Group Inc in a $23.24 billion cash-and-stock deal.

TITLE: Lennar to spin-off some non-core units, form a rental housing venture
DESCRIPTION: Lennar Corp said on Wednesday it plans to spin-off all or parts of its non-core businesses to become a pure-play homebuilder and financial services company, while also creating a joint venture to provide single family homes for rent.

TITLE: Morgan Stanley becomes first major U.S. bank to offer clients access to bitcoin funds: CNBC
DESCRIPTION: Morgan Stanley has become the first big U.S. bank to offer its wealth management clients access to bitcoin funds, CNBC reported on Wednesday.

TITLE: Exclusive: Chime prepares stock market listing as online banking grows - sources
DESCRIPTION: Chime has held preliminary talks with investment banks about launching a stock market flotation, which could value the financial services startup at more than $30 billion, as soon as the end of 2021, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

TITLE: Mastercard, Visa to delay raising card fees until April next year
DESCRIPTION: Mastercard Inc and Visa Inc on Tuesday postponed plans to raise the fees U.S. merchants pay when customers use cards online until April next year, as businesses continue to struggle during the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: German towns facing Greensill Bank losses band together
DESCRIPTION: Some 26 German towns facing 255 million euros ($303 million) in losses are combining forces as they seek to recover funds in the insolvency proceedings of Greensill Bank, a town coordinating the effort said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Court in Bremen opens insolvency proceedings for Greensill Bank: statement
DESCRIPTION: A district court in Bremen said on Tuesday that it had opened insolvency proceedings for Greensill Bank.

TITLE: Russia readies for IPO flurry that will raise at least $10 billion this year, says UBS
DESCRIPTION: Russian companies, back on global investors' radar since late last year, are set for an IPO boom in 2021 with initial public offerings expected to raise at least $10 billion, the highest in more than a decade, says UBS.

TITLE: Bank of Portugal governor expects banking M&A as natural step
DESCRIPTION: Mergers and acquisitions are a "natural" next step for Portuguese banks pressured by record low interest rates, Bank of Portugal Governor Mario Centeno said on Monday.

TITLE: A year since Black Monday 2 and a round trip for markets
DESCRIPTION: It's a year since COVID-19 mayhem sent the S&P 500 index reeling 12% for its second-worst day ever, yet the bull market born from that selloff has in the subsequent 12 months added more than $40 trillion to the value of world stocks.

TITLE: ECB ups bond buys to cap rise in yields
DESCRIPTION: The European Central Bank increased bond purchases last week to cap yields, stepping up its market activity even before policymakers decided to "significantly" raise asset buys, fresh data showed on Monday.

TITLE: Sacklers boost opioid settlement offer to $4.3 billion: sources
DESCRIPTION: Members of the Sackler family who own Purdue Pharma LP have offered roughly $4.3 billion to resolve sprawling opioid litigation, up from $3 billion initially proposed in settlement discussions underway in the OxyContin maker's bankruptcy proceedings, four people familiar...

TITLE: SoftBank reaps $33 billion Coupang windfall
DESCRIPTION: SoftBank Group Corp on Thursday racked up a roughly $33 billion gain on paper through the public market debut of South Korea's largest e-commerce company, Coupang Inc, the latest sign of a dramatic turnaround for its $100 billion Vision Fund.

TITLE: Barclays to pay own $46 million legal bill in Staveley court case
DESCRIPTION: A judge ruled Barclays will have to pay its own 33 million pound ($46.09 million) legal bill despite winning a case against British businesswoman Amanda Staveley's PCP Capital Group over how the bank negotiated a financial lifeline during the credit crisis in 2008.

TITLE: Spain ups direct aid to SMEs to 7 billion euros in relief plan, source says
DESCRIPTION: The Spanish government's direct aid to small and medium-sized companies, to be approved by the cabinet on Friday, will likely total 7 billion euros ($8.4 billion), up from a previously-proposed 5 billion, a government source told Reuters.

TITLE: WTO cautious after sharp services trade rebound
DESCRIPTION: Trade in services grew an accelerated pace at the end of last year, but momentum appears set to slow as spikes of COVID-19 cases bring a return of lockdowns, the World Trade Organization said on Thursday.

TITLE: Digital-only artwork fetches nearly $70 million at Christie's
DESCRIPTION: A digital artwork sold for nearly $70 million at Christie's on Thursday, in the first ever sale by a major auction house of a piece of art that does not exist in physical form.

TITLE: Senate committee votes in favor of Biden pick to lead SEC, split on CFPB nominee
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee on Wednesday voted in favor of President Joe Biden's pick to chair the Securities and Exchange Commission, but was tied when it came to approving his nominee to run the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

TITLE: Trump¡¯s former fixer Michael Cohen to meet again with Manhattan DA in Trump probe
DESCRIPTION: Donald Trump¡¯s former lawyer and fixer, Michael Cohen, said he would go in for a seventh interview on Wednesday with the Manhattan district attorney¡¯s office pursuing a criminal investigation into the former U.S. president.

TITLE: Trumpâs former fixer Michael Cohen to meet again with Manhattan DA in Trump probe
DESCRIPTION: Donald Trumpâs former lawyer and fixer, Michael Cohen, said he would go in for a seventh interview on Wednesday with the Manhattan district attorneyâs office pursuing a criminal investigation into the former U.S. president.

TITLE: U.S. gaming platform Roblox set for strong market debut
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Roblox Corp were set for a jump of up to 44% in their market debut on Wednesday.

TITLE: Gaming company Roblox surges 54% in debut on NYSE
DESCRIPTION: Shares of U.S. gaming company Roblox Corp closed up 54.4% in its New York Stock Exchange trading debut on Wednesday, valuing the company at $45.2 billion.

TITLE: Big-name investors bet bond sell-off has further to run
DESCRIPTION: Some of the world's biggest investors are slashing exposure to government bonds on expectations that the debt sell-off is just getting started, and without too swift a rise in borrowing costs, most central banks will not intervene.

TITLE: Key U.S. lawmaker questions May deadline for troop pullout from Afghanistan
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee Chairman Bob Menendez said on Tuesday a May 1 deadline for withdrawing U.S. forces from Afghanistan may have to be reconsidered because the Taliban are not meeting their commitments under a 2020 peace deal.

TITLE: JPMorgan to wind down digital wallet Chase Pay
DESCRIPTION: JPMorgan Chase & Co will discontinue its Chase Pay digital wallet at the end of the month, according to a notice on the bank's website.

TITLE: JPMorgan hires new head of fintech and innovation for wholesale payments
DESCRIPTION: JPMorgan Chase & Co has hired former HSBC Holdings Plc executive Jeremy Balkin as head of fintech and innovation for wholesale payments, the bank said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Billionaire David Tepper bullish on stocks, sees rising rates stabilize: CNBC
DESCRIPTION: Hedge fund manager David Tepper said it is difficult to be bearish on stocks at present and the recent selloff in U.S. Treasuries that drove up interest rates is over, CNBC reported on Monday, citing an interview with the billionaire.

TITLE: Geico must face lawsuit claiming it overcharged on car insurance during pandemic: judge
DESCRIPTION: The auto insurer Geico Corp, a unit of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc, must face a proposed class action claiming it overcharged policyholders as the coronavirus pandemic led to less driving and fewer accidents, a judge has ruled.

TITLE: German city calls on Berlin to assume any Greensill Bank losses
DESCRIPTION: German city Osnabrueck fears it will lose 14 million euros ($17 million) invested with Greensill Bank after the country's financial regulator warned this week of "an imminent risk" to the lender.

TITLE: Goldman poised to make $100 million profit off Texas deep freeze - Bloomberg News
DESCRIPTION: Traders at Goldman Sachs Group Inc could earn roughly $100 million in profit from the winter storm last month that left many across Texas and other southern U.S. states without electricity, clean water and heat, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.

TITLE: U.S. denies report of potential sanctions on Lebanese central bank chief
DESCRIPTION: Washington denied on Friday that it was considering imposing sanctions on Lebanon's veteran central bank governor Riad Salameh, whose role in the country's financial turmoil has come under fresh scrutiny.

TITLE: Alphabet-backed Oscar Health valued at $7.09 billion in lackluster debut
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Oscar Health fell more than 7% in their stock market debut on Wednesday, fetching a valuation of just over $7 billion for the health insurance startup backed by Google parent Alphabet Inc.

TITLE: Greensill Bank says it immediately complied with German watchdog's request over asset classification
DESCRIPTION: Greensill Bank said on Wednesday it had immediately complied with a request by Germany's financial watchdog BaFin after it raised concerns late last year over accounting practices.

TITLE: German watchdog puts Greensill Bank on hold due to risk concerns
DESCRIPTION: Germany's financial watchdog warned of "an imminent risk" that Greensill Bank would become over-indebted on Wednesday as it imposed a moratorium on the lender making disposals or payments.

TITLE: Rocket shares soar more than 70% as analysts eye 'GameStop-esque' short squeeze
DESCRIPTION: Heavily shorted mortgage provider Rocket Companies saw its stock surge on Tuesday, in an eye-popping move reminiscent of the rallies that powered GameStop <GME.N> and other so-called meme stocks earlier in the year.

TITLE: This year's Nobel Peace Prize draws hundreds of nominees
DESCRIPTION: Some 329 nominations have been received for this year's Nobel Peace Prize, likely reflecting the profusion of pressing human rights issues around the world, the secretary of the committee which awards the prize said on Monday.

TITLE: Russia seen holding interest rates throughout 2021: Reuters poll
DESCRIPTION: The Russian central bank is expected to take a wait-and-see stance and hold its key interest rate throughout 2021 as the economy returns to growth and inflation gradually slows, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.

TITLE: Italy's MPS working to cut legal risks as EU weighs bank's viability
DESCRIPTION: Italy's Monte dei Paschi (MPS) said on Thursday it was working to reduce its legal risks while the European Union assessed the state-owned bank's ability to stay in business before unlocking more public aid.

TITLE: Brazil central bank intervenes in spot FX for first time this year, sells $1.5 billion
DESCRIPTION: Brazil's central bank intervened in the spot foreign exchange market on Thursday for the first time this year, selling $1.5 billion in two auctions as the real slumped to its weakest against the U.S. dollar in over four months.

TITLE: Global money laundering watchdog keeps Pakistan on terrorism financing 'grey list'
DESCRIPTION: Global money laundering watchdog the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) on Thursday said it would keep Pakistan on its terrorism financing "grey list".

TITLE: Pandemic, EU billions drive Greece's digital revolution
DESCRIPTION: Before COVID-19, visits to Greece's paper-strewn labour offices were a ordeal of queues and case files, often for basic matters that in less than a year have moved online as the pandemic upended old administrative routines.

TITLE: Fedwire resumes operations after hourslong disruption
DESCRIPTION: The Federal Reserve says its Fedwire Funds, Fedcash and some check clearing services have resumed normal operations after a more than three-hour disruption to more than a dozen critical central bank payment services forming the backbone of the U.S. banking system.

TITLE: Analysis: Central banks say no tapering. Markets are not buying it
DESCRIPTION: Central bankers worldwide have been unequivocal: There are no plans to cut back on money-printing any time soon, let alone raise interest rates.

TITLE: UK will resist 'dubious' EU pressure on banks, says BoE's Bailey
DESCRIPTION: Britain will resist "very firmly" any European Union attempts to arm-twist banks into shifting trillions of euros in derivatives clearing from Britain to the bloc after Brexit, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said on Wednesday.

TITLE: Analysis: As bond selloff gets real, policymakers face fresh headache
DESCRIPTION: Inflation-adjusted government bond yields are rising and so is pressure on Fed and ECB policymakers to somehow tamp down the increase before it wrecks the economic recovery they have carefully nurtured with enormous amounts of money-printing.

TITLE: Amazon SVP Jeff Blackburn is departing the company Tuesday
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc Senior Vice President Jeff Blackburn is leaving the company on Tuesday after 22 years, he said in an internal note that the online retailer shared with Reuters.

TITLE: EU targets online platforms after Wall Street short squeeze
DESCRIPTION: Online platforms like Robinhood in the United States that offer commission-free share trading to retail investors would be illegal in the European Union, officials from the bloc said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Analysis: Vaccine rollout a shot in the arm for soaring sterling
DESCRIPTION: Sterling looks set to extend its rally beyond $1.40, thanks to the pace of Britain's COVID-19 vaccine rollout and signs that investors are flocking back to assets out of favour during years of Brexit turmoil.

TITLE: BoE's Vlieghe doubts he will ever see rates back at 5%
DESCRIPTION: Bank of England policymaker Gertjan Vlieghe said on Monday that he did not expect British interest rates to return to levels common before the 2008 financial crisis during his lifetime, due partly to the effect of an ageing population.

TITLE: Brazil markets tank as Bolsonaro shakes up Petrobras to cut energy costs
DESCRIPTION: Brazilian financial markets went into a tailspin on Monday, as investors dumped the country's currency and stocks, while pushing up interest rates, after President Jair Bolsonaro moved late on Friday to sack the head of state-run oil firm Petrobras following weeks of clashes...

TITLE: Bitcoin falls below $50,000, hits lowest since mid-February
DESCRIPTION: Bitcoin dropped below $50,000 on Monday, hitting its lowest level since mid-February, as investors worried that its price may have gotten too high, too fast.

TITLE: Key quotes from the GameStop testimonies: 'I am not a cat'
DESCRIPTION: At a grilling by lawmakers over the frenzied trading in retailer GameStop, Keith Gill, a YouTube streamer known as Roaring Kitty, hedge fund managers and the head of Robinhood and Reddit defended their actions.

TITLE: GameStop briefly rallies after 'Roaring Kitty' testifies to Congress
DESCRIPTION: Shares of GameStop briefly reversed losses on Thursday after the trader known as Roaring Kitty told a congressional hearing he remained optimistic about the stock following its recent rally and selloff.

TITLE: GameStop frenzy sparks fresh investment in stock-trading apps
DESCRIPTION: The recent trading frenzy centered on GameStop Corp and other âmemeâ stocks is sparking a wave of investor interest in start-ups aiming to mimic the success of Robinhood Markets Inc, whose no-fee brokerage app has helped drive a trading boom.

TITLE: Biden will ask DOJ to review his authority to cancel student loan debt - White House
DESCRIPTION: President Joe Biden will ask the Department of Justice to review his legal authority to cancel student loan debt, the White House said on Wednesday, adding the president does not favor $50,000 in student loan relief without limitation.

TITLE: Online trading platform Plus500 mulls U.S. expansion after record year
DESCRIPTION: London-listed online trading platform Plus500 plans to venture into North America after a surge in profits for 2020 as company benefited from a boom in small-time traders making big bets on financial markets.

TITLE: Exclusive: German investor Angermayer to launch biotech SPAC in the U.S. - sources
DESCRIPTION: German investor Christian Angermayer is planning to list a blank-cheque company in New York, embracing a trend that has seen a swathe of entrepreneurs tapping into investor interest in new offerings, two people close to the matter said.

TITLE: Coinbase appoints former Stripe executive as compliance chief
DESCRIPTION: Coinbase has appointed former Stripe executive Melissa Strait as chief compliance officer, as the U.S. cryptocurrency exchange prepares for a direct listing, the company said on Wednesday.

TITLE: White House says Biden believes Nord Stream 2 bad deal for Europe
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden the Nord Stream 2 pipeline is a bad deal for Europe and will make determine whether sanctions are in order to stop the project from Russia to Germany, White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki told reporters on Tuesday.

TITLE: Fed's George: Pandemic changes in housing, work patterns could stress real estate markets
DESCRIPTION: The United States could face financial stress even as the pandemic eases if homeowners and businesses fall behind on mortgages and business leases while the economy recovers, Kansas City Federal Reserve President Esther George said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Canadian regulator clears launch of world's first bitcoin ETF: investment manager
DESCRIPTION: Canada's main securities regulator has cleared the launch of the world's first bitcoin exchange traded fund, an investment manager said on Friday, providing investors greater access to the cryptocurrency that has sparked an explosion in trading interest.

TITLE: Miami mayor sees bitcoin move as way to attract tech
DESCRIPTION: The city of Miami is seeking to embrace bitcoin in its operations, a move that could bring dividends in terms of attracting technology companies, Mayor Francis Suarez said on Friday.

TITLE: Bitcoin donations surge to jailed Kremlin critic Navalny's cause: data
DESCRIPTION: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny's movement has received bitcoin donations worth nearly $300,000 this year, outstripping the total amount it was given in the cryptocurrency in 2020 at the prices at the time, according to a data analysis.

TITLE: Just 270 crypto addresses laundered $1.3 billion in dirty funds last year, research shows
DESCRIPTION: Criminals are using a small group of cryptocurrency brokers and services to launder hundreds of millions of dollars of dirty virtual money, research shared with Reuters showed on Thursday.

TITLE: BoE's Bailey warns EU not to pick a fight on finance
DESCRIPTION: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey urged the European Union on Wednesday not to pick a fight with Britain over its huge financial services industry after Brexit, and said the bloc was demanding more of London than of other trade partners.

TITLE: Cash flush Americans buying shares as pandemic limits spending options
DESCRIPTION: Americans stuck at home and with more discretionary funds at their disposal but fewer spending options because of the COVID-19 pandemic are piling into the stock market and sprucing up their homes, a survey showed on Tuesday.

TITLE: Reddit-fuelled retail trading frenzy spreads to Europe
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. retail stock trading phenomenon driven by the WallStreetBets Reddit forum is fuelling a copycat trading boom in Europe, bank and brokerages said.

TITLE: Biden, meeting business leaders, backs stricter income limits for stimulus checks
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday he agreed with a proposal by Democratic lawmakers that would limit or phase out stimulus payments to higher-income individuals as part of his $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief bill.

TITLE: World trade system needs full U.S. participation-WTO official
DESCRIPTION: A functioning global trading system needs "full and active participation" by the United States, World Trade Organization Deputy Director General Alan Wolff said on Tuesday, adding that subsidies need to be addressed in any future reforms to the trade body.

TITLE: Explainer: What rising bond yields mean for markets
DESCRIPTION: Yields on U.S. Treasuries are rising again, as expectations of an economic rebound pushed the 30-year yield above 2% on Monday for the first time since the pandemic began and the benchmark 10-year yield climbed to its highest level since early 2020. [US/]

TITLE: Goldman Sachs boosts U.S. GDP estimate, sees COVID relief at $1.5 trillion
DESCRIPTION: Economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc on Monday bumped their U.S. GDP forecast for the second quarter up to 11% from 10% and said additional fiscal measures are likely to be valued at $1.5 trillion, up from their previous $1.1 trillion estimate.

TITLE: U.S. Senator Shelby will not seek reelection: statement
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senator Richard Shelby, 86, said on Monday he would not seek reelection for a seventh term in 2022, becoming the latest Republican senator to step down ahead of a midterm campaign that is likely to be spirited and expensive.

TITLE: BoE's Bailey says quick fixes to avoid LCF collapse were not possible
DESCRIPTION: Bank of England chief Andrew Bailey angrily hit back at criticism that he failed to overhaul a regulator quickly enough to avert the collapse of the London Capital & Finance investment firm, saying the regulator had been a "broken machine."

TITLE: ECB must keep easy money policy in place despite inflation surge: Lagarde
DESCRIPTION: The European Central Bank must keep copious stimulus in place as an unexpected surge in inflation last month masks weak underlying dynamics, ECB President Christine Lagarde said on Monday.

TITLE: Luxembourg fund industry is a $5.4 trillion 'black box', investigation says
DESCRIPTION: Luxembourg's investment fund industry is a financial "black box" that helps people launder illicit money and avoid tax, according to an investigation published on Monday whose findings were rejected by the EU nation.

TITLE: Biden adviser says phase-out level for COVID-19 relief checks open to negotiation
DESCRIPTION: White House economic adviser Jared Berstein on Friday said the phase-out level for coronavirus relief checks in the Biden coronavirus stimulus plan is open to negotiation.

TITLE: Texas court considers hearing on changing venue of Google antitrust case
DESCRIPTION: A Texas court considering a state antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google is likely to hold a hearing on the company's request to move the trial to California, according to discussions at a status conference on Thursday.

TITLE: BNY Mellon, Google Cloud technology to predict Treasury settlement failures
DESCRIPTION: The Bank of New York Mellon Corp said on Thursday it has partnered with Google Cloud on technology that uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to predict when BNY Mellon's clients' U.S. Treasury transactions will fail to settle.

TITLE: NY money manager charged in $1.8 billion Ponzi-like fraud
DESCRIPTION: The founder of a New York money manager and two associates were criminally charged on Thursday with running a $1.8 billion Ponzi-like fraud where thousands of victims were falsely promised steady returns on their investments.

TITLE: Factbox: The long and short of it: GameStop and other market squeezes
DESCRIPTION: Last week's frenzied battle over GameStop that pitted retail traders against Wall Street hedge funds joins a long line of tussles between investors going 'long' by buying shares and those seeking to turn a profit from 'short' trades.

TITLE: Exclusive: Suspected Chinese hackers used SolarWinds bug to spy on U.S. payroll agency â sources
DESCRIPTION: By Christopher Bing, Jack Stubbs, Raphael Satter and Joseph Menn

TITLE: Vodafone prepares telecom towers business for March IPO: sources
DESCRIPTION: Vodafone plans to float Vantage Towers, its European mobile phone masts business, on the Frankfurt stock exchange in March in a share offering worth about 3 billion euros ($3.6 billion), three people close to the matter said.

TITLE: Factbox: How silver is traded, from stocks and shares to coins and bars
DESCRIPTION: Silver prices rocketed to their highest since 2013 on Monday after small investors responded to calls on Reddit and other social media to pile into the market and push prices up.

TITLE: GameStop trading resumes after brief halt as shares tumble
DESCRIPTION: Shares of videogame retailer GameStop Corp resumed trading on the New York Stock Exchange after being briefly halted following a 42% slump when the markets opened on Tuesday.

TITLE: Democrats ready $1.9 trillion budget measure for COVID relief: Schumer
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said on Monday that congressional Democrats would file a $1.9 trillion budget resolution later in the day, as a first step toward eventual passage of sweeping COVID-19 relief legislation.

TITLE: Brokerage Public.com to halt controversial order flow practice
DESCRIPTION: Brokerage Public.com said on Monday it would no longer route orders to market makers to execute trades and instead send them directly to exchanges, in an attempt to remove a potential conflict of interest with its customers.

TITLE: Former UK finance minister Osborne joins M&A bank Robey Warshaw
DESCRIPTION: Former British finance minister George Osborne has taken a top role at boutique investment bank Robey Warshaw, joining a long line of politicians to land lucrative roles in high finance.

TITLE: Robinhood raises another $2.4 billion in funds from investors
DESCRIPTION: Robinhood has tapped $2.4 billion in funding on top of the $1 billion it raised last week after the online brokerage's finances were strained due to a retail trading frenzy in heavily shorted shares of companies such as GameStop Corp.

TITLE: Biden says action on COVID-19 stimulus needed 'now'
DESCRIPTION: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Friday that Congress needs to take immediate action on his $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief proposal, adding that most economists believe additional economic stimulus is needed.

TITLE: UK trading app Freetrade disables orders to buy U.S. stocks
DESCRIPTION: Commission-free trading app Freetrade said on Friday it had disabled buy orders for U.S. stocks amid a market frenzy that has seen shares of heavily shorted stocks like GameStop surge this week after being pushed on social media platforms.

TITLE: European regulator gives green light for Astra-Oxford COVID-19 vaccine
DESCRIPTION: Europe's medicines regulator on Friday approved AstraZeneca and Oxford University's COVID-19 vaccine for people over the age of 18, the third vaccine to be cleared for use in the European Union.

TITLE: WeWork in talks to go public through SPAC deal
DESCRIPTION: WeWork is in talks to go public through a merger with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) and is also exploring raising funds from private investors, a little over a year after its botched initial public offering (IPO), according to a source familiar with the matter...

TITLE: U.S. commercial paper market grows in week: Fed
DESCRIPTION: The amount of U.S. commercial paper grew in the week ended Jan 27 Federal Reserve data showed on Thursday.

TITLE: Costly short squeeze makes Reddit required reading on Wall Street
DESCRIPTION: Dennis Dick, a professional stock trader in Las Vegas, reads the site Seeking Alpha before work and keeps up to the minute throughout the trading day by watching Twitter, but last weekend he also joined a group on the popular online discussion board Reddit "because I need...

TITLE: Widespread internet outage hits U.S. East Coast
DESCRIPTION: Thousands of users across the U.S. East Coast faced widespread internet outage from providers including Verizon Communications Inc on Tuesday, disrupting services offered by Google, Amazon, Zoom, Slack and other tech firms.

TITLE: U.S. fintech startup Albert raises $100 million
DESCRIPTION: US financial technology startup Albert has raised $100 million in a round led by General Atlantic, the company said on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. business borrowing for equipment falls 6% in December: ELFA
DESCRIPTION: U.S. companies' borrowings for capital investments fell about 6% in December from a year earlier, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association (ELFA) said on Monday.

TITLE: Time to pause? Wall St. grows wary of some stock bubbles
DESCRIPTION: Growing concerns about stock bubbles on Wall Street are sparking fears of a pullback, highlighted by the wild ride for shares such as GameStop Corp.

TITLE: FX traders brush off ECB talk, bet euro-dollar has further to run
DESCRIPTION: How strong is the euro really? Despite European policymakers' alarm over its run to 2-1/2-year highs against the dollar, several factors governing exchange rates imply the single currency's bout of strength is far from over.

TITLE: EU approves German coronavirus state aid scheme
DESCRIPTION: The European Commission said on Thursday it had approved the German government's 12-billion-euro scheme to compensate companies for damages incurred due to coronavirus lockdowns last year.

TITLE: Explainer: Bond yields are rising. Why does it matter?
DESCRIPTION: U.S. Treasury bond yields have been shaken out of hibernation and are back above 1% after hitting record lows last year, on hopes of an economic rebound in the United States.

TITLE: Biden appoints U.S. consumer watchdog veteran as acting director after Trump appointee resigns
DESCRIPTION: The White House announced President Joe Biden would appoint Dave Uejio to run the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) on an acting basis after its director, Kathy Kraninger, resigned at the new administration's request.

TITLE: Analysis: Europe Inc earnings in no man's land between recession and recovery
DESCRIPTION: Europe Inc's fourth-quarter reporting season will test investor confidence in profit recovery as a new round of social restrictions is expected to have driven earnings down more than 25% while further blurring the outlook.

TITLE: WHO health regulations need tweaks but not major change - panel
DESCRIPTION: The International Health Regulations remain a cornerstone of public health security and need improving in some areas, but not major changes, the chair of a World Health Organization (WHO) panel reviewing the 2005 rules said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Dating app Bumble reveals steady revenue growth, losses in IPO filing
DESCRIPTION: Dating app Bumble, which is backed by private equity firm Blackstone Group, on Friday made public its regulatory filing for an initial public offering, revealing steady revenue growth and higher operating costs that resulted in a loss.

TITLE: Bitcoin surge helps lift Grayscale assets to record $20 billion in 2020
DESCRIPTION: Grayscale, the world's largest digital currency manager, said on Thursday its assets under management surged more than 900% to $20.2 billion at the end of last year, lifted by record inflows in the fourth quarter and the surge in the price of bitcoin.

TITLE: Japan's households, firms keep piling up cash at record pace as pandemic persists
DESCRIPTION: Japan's currency in circulation and bank deposits rose at a record pace in December, data showed on Wednesday, as a resurgence in coronavirus infections prompted companies and households to continue hoarding cash rather than spending it.

TITLE: Analysis: Wall Street brushes off political turmoil, looks to economic rebound
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. stock market is mostly unfazed by the political turmoil in Washington and fears of violence ahead of President-elect Joe Bidenâs inauguration, with investors squarely focused on the probability of another sizeable stimulus package to boost economic growth and the...

TITLE: Progress stalls in Afghan peace talks as sides await Biden
DESCRIPTION: Afghan peace talks that resumed four days ago are effectively on hold, sources from both sides said on Wednesday, as negotiators wait for President-elect Joe Biden to signal whether he will stick to Donald Trump's aggressive schedule to pull out troops.

TITLE: BlackRock co-founder Barbara Novick to retire
DESCRIPTION: Asset manager BlackRock Inc said in a memo on Wednesday that co-founder Barbara Novick will retire from her role as vice chairman next month.
